name: AzureDls
help: (PREVIEW) Manage Data Lake Store accounts and filesystems.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: DefaultGroup
properties.help: Name of the default group to give permissions to for freshly created files and folders in the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: DisableEncryption
properties.help: Indicates that the account will not have any form of encryption applied to it.

properties.name: EncryptionType
properties.help: Indicates what type of encryption to provision the account with. By default, encryption is ServiceManaged. If no encryption is desired, it must be explicitly set with the --disable-encryption flag.

properties.name: KeyName
properties.help: Key name for the user-assigned encryption type.

properties.name: KeyVaultId
properties.help: Key vault for the user-assigned encryption type.

properties.name: KeyVersion
properties.help: Key version for the user-assigned encryption type.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.name: Tier
properties.help: The desired commitment tier for this account to use.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: If not specified, will attempt to discover the resource group for the specified Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: If not specified, will attempt to discover the resource group for the specified Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: If not specified, will attempt to discover the resource group for the specified Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: AllowAzureIps
properties.help: Allow/block Azure originating IPs through the firewall.

properties.name: FirewallState
properties.help: Enable/disable existing firewall rules.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: If not specified, will attempt to discover the resource group for the specified Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.name: Tier
properties.help: The desired commitment tier for this account to use.

properties.name: TrustedIdProviderState
properties.help: Enable/disable the existing trusted ID providers.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: Content
properties.help: Content to be appended to the file.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The path in the specified Data Lake Store account where the action should take place. In the format '/folder/file.txt', where the first '/' after the DNS indicates the root of the file system.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The path in the specified Data Lake Store account where the action should take place. In the format '/folder/file.txt', where the first '/' after the DNS indicates the root of the file system.

properties.name: Content
properties.help: Content for the file to contain upon creation.

properties.name: Folder
properties.help: Indicates that this new item is a folder and not a file.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Indicates that, if the file or folder exists, it should be overwritten.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The path in the specified Data Lake Store account where the action should take place. In the format '/folder/file.txt', where the first '/' after the DNS indicates the root of the file system.

properties.name: Recurse
properties.help: Indicates this should be a recursive delete of the folder.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: DestinationPath
properties.help: The local path where the file or folder will be downloaded to.

properties.name: SourcePath
properties.help: The full path in the Data Lake Store filesystem to download the file or folder from.

properties.name: BlockSize
properties.help: Size of a block, in bytes.

properties.name: BufferSize
properties.help: Size of the transfer buffer, in bytes.

properties.name: ChunkSize
properties.help: Size of a chunk, in bytes.

properties.name: Overwrite
properties.help: Indicates that, if the destination file or folder exists, it should be overwritten.

properties.name: ThreadCount
properties.help: Parallelism of the download. Default: The number of cores in the local machine.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: DestinationPath
properties.help: The destination path in the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: SourcePaths
properties.help: The space-separated list of files in the Data Lake Store account to join.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Indicates that, if the destination file already exists, it should be overwritten.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The path in the specified Data Lake Store account where the action should take place. In the format '/folder/file.txt', where the first '/' after the DNS indicates the root of the file system.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: DestinationPath
properties.help: The destination path in the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: SourcePath
properties.help: The file or folder to move.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Indicates that, if the destination file or folder already exists, it should be overwritten and replaced with the file or folder being moved.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The path in the specified Data Lake Store account where the action should take place. In the format '/folder/file.txt', where the first '/' after the DNS indicates the root of the file system.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Indicates that, if the preview is larger than 1MB, still retrieve it. This can potentially be very slow, depending on how large the file is.

properties.name: Length
properties.help: The amount of data to preview in bytes.

properties.name: Offset
properties.help: The position in bytes to start the preview from.

properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: ExpirationTime
properties.help: The absolute value of the expiration time expressed as milliseconds since the epoch.

properties.name: DestinationPath
properties.help: The full path in the Data Lake Store filesystem to upload the file or folder to.

properties.name: SourcePath
properties.help: The path to the file or folder to upload.

properties.name: BlockSize
properties.help: Size of a block, in bytes.

properties.name: BufferSize
properties.help: Size of the transfer buffer, in bytes.

properties.name: ChunkSize
properties.help: Size of a chunk, in bytes.

properties.name: Overwrite
properties.help: Indicates that, if the destination file or folder exists, it should be overwritten.

properties.name: ThreadCount
properties.help: Parallelism of the upload. Default: The number of cores in the local machine.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: EndIpAddress
properties.help: The end of the valid ip range for the firewall rule.

properties.name: FirewallRuleName
properties.help: The name of the firewall rule.

properties.name: StartIpAddress
properties.help: The start of the valid ip range for the firewall rule.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: FirewallRuleName
properties.help: The name of the firewall rule to update.

properties.name: EndIpAddress
properties.help: The end IP address for the firewall rule. This can be either ipv4 or ipv6. Start and End should be in the same protocol.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: If not specified, will attempt to discover the resource group for the specified Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: StartIpAddress
properties.help: The start IP address for the firewall rule. This can be either ipv4 or ipv6. Start and End should be in the same protocol.

properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: TrustedIdProviderName
properties.help: The name of the trusted identity provider. This is used for differentiation of providers in the account.

properties.help: Name or ID of the subnet that allows access to DLS. If subnet name is provided, --name must be provided.

properties.name: Add
properties.help: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>.

properties.name: ForceString
properties.help: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

properties.name: Remove
properties.help: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The path in the specified Data Lake Store account where the action should take place. In the format '/folder/file.txt', where the first '/' after the DNS indicates the root of the file system.

properties.name: DefaultAcl
properties.help: A switch that, if specified, indicates that the remove ACL operation should remove the default ACL of the folder. Otherwise the regular ACL is removed.

properties.name: Account
properties.help: Name of the Data Lake Store account.

properties.name: AclSpec
properties.help: The ACL specification to set on the path in the format '[default:]user|group|other:[entity id or UPN]:r|-w|-x|-,[default:]user|group|other:[entity id or UPN]:r|-w|-x|-,...'.

commonTaskProperties.help: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

commonTaskProperties.help: Show this help message and exit.

commonTaskProperties.help: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.
